knimeNode.name: Table to R
knimeNode.shortDescription: Converts a KNIME data table into an R object.

fullDescription.intro:
Converts a KNIME data table into an R object which can be manipulated during execution. The input data is written to a CSV file and imported into an R workspace which is then available at the node out-port. The data must be returned as variable called R.
More details about R:
http://www.r-project.org/
Short-refcard.pdf

tab.name: R Command
tab.option: The list contains the column that are available in the input table. Double click any of the column names to insert the respective field in the expression editor. It will replace your current selection or simply insert at the current caret position.

The list contains the flow variables that are currently available at the node input. Double clicking any of the entries will insert the respective identifier at the current cursor position (replacing the selection, if any).

tab.name: R Binary
tab.option: Path to the local R executable. Note that it is possible to specify the path to the local R executable also in the R section of the KNIME preferences.
Add additional arguments run together with the R binary. The '--vanilla' mode ensures a clean workspace and may cause problems when removed.
If checked, the specified file is used as R binary. If not checked, the file specified in the KNIME's R preferences is used.

views.view: The text sent to standard out during the execution of R executable as well as the text of the .Rout file generated by R.

The text sent to standard error during the execution of R executable as well as the text of the .Rout file generated by R. (If it appears in gray, it's the output of a previously failing run which is preserved for your trouble shooting.)
